intro: Denhamia, commonly known as the mountain gum, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy, often red or pink flowers. The plants typically grow in dry, rocky habitats and are well adapted to arid conditions. Denhamia species are often shrubs or small trees, with smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. They play an important role in the ecological systems of their native regions.
